steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "readyForInstallation" state
I wait "45" seconds
the cluster does not have MapR Installed

name: Cluster Version Graph Capture

As a Spyglass Contributor

I capture the versions of all components that constitute the Cluster Under Test

steps.name: I request the cluster version graph
it returns a valid JSON file

The result has at least 1 log containing the word "warden"

name: Hardware Maintenance
description:
As a Spyglass Contributor
In order to manage and debug known, reproducible environments for dev and testing purposes
I can create, destroy, and inspect ESXI-based cluster snapshots

steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "baseImage" state
the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I delete "readyForInstallation" snapshots for each node in the cluster
the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I request the latest snapshot info from the cluster
the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I take "readyForInstallation" snapshots of each node in the cluster

elements.name: Create Ready for Installation State from Base CentOS VM Image

steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "baseImage" state
I wait "30" seconds
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:
echo `hostname -I`    `hostname` >> /etc/hosts
    echo 'nameserver 10.10.1.10' > /etc/resolv.conf
    echo 'nameserver 10.250.1.3' >> /etc/resolv.conf
    echo 'nameserver 10.10.100.241' >> /etc/resolv.conf
    echo 'PEERDNS=no' > /etc/sysconfig/network
    #{{packageCommand}} install -y curl
    #{{packageCommand}} install -y ntp
    #systemctl enable ntpd
    #systemctl start ntpd

steps.name: I wait "10" seconds
I take "readyForInstallation" snapshots of each node in the cluster
I manually retrieve the ids of these new snapshots based on the console output of the previous step
I manually update the configured "readyForInstallation" state for the cluster with the snapshot ids

elements.name: Create Ready for Installation State from Base CentOS VM Image

steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "baseImage" state
I wait "30" seconds
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:
I take "readyForInstallation" snapshots of each node in the cluster
I retrieve the latest snapshot info for the cluster and output it to stdout
I manually update the configured "readyForInstallation" state for the cluster with the snapshot ids

elements.name: Create Ready for Installation State from Base SUSE 12 IMAGE

steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "baseImage" state
I wait "30" seconds
I perform the following ssh commands on each node in the cluster:

doc_string.value:
#write the hostname and configured IP to /etc/hosts so it resolves
zypper addrepo http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/system:packagemanager/SLE_12/system:packagemanager.repo
zypper refresh -f
zypper install yum

steps.name: I take "readyForInstallation" snapshots of each node in the cluster
I retrieve the latest snapshot info for the cluster and output it to stdout
I manually update the configured "readyForInstallation" state for the cluster with the snapshot ids

name: Installation
description:
As a Spyglass Customer
In order to install a Spyglass-enabled MapR Cluster
I use one of the following installation methods

steps.name: I follow the manual installation instructions located at "https://github.com/mapr/private-spyglass"
it tells me how to install, configure and run the services required for Spyglass
it tells me how to discover the URLs for MCS, Kibana, Grafana, OpenTSDB and ElasticSearch
the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I ssh into the node hosting "mapr-installer"
within my ssh session, I download "/mapr-setup.sh" to "/tmp" from the repository for the "mapr-installer" component family
within my ssh session, I execute "/tmp/mapr-setup.sh -y -u [installerRepoURL] [maprCoreRepoURL] [ecosystemRepoURL]"
I wait "15" seconds
it successfully starts the installer web server and outputs its URL to the screen

elements.name: Use REST APIs to Install MapR with Spyglass Components

steps.name: I can authenticate my GUI Installer Rest Client
I specify and save the desired Cluster Configuration
I perform Cluster Configuration Verification
I perform Cluster Provisioning
I perform Cluster Installation

elements.name: Use Web Interface to Install MapR with Spyglass Components

steps.name: the GUI Installer web server is running
I can authenticate my browser using the GUI Installer Login Page
I indicate I want a basic installation with Spyglass components and their dependencies only
the website indicates that the installation succeeds within "5" minutes

elements.name: View Warden Log in Discovery Tab

steps.name: I have installed Spyglass
I have determined the kibana server and port for that cluster
I navigate to kibana's discovery interface
I see at least one log from warden

elements.name: Spyglass Services appear Healthy in MCS after Installation

steps.name: I have installed Spyglass
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
I use the MCS Rest Client Session to retrieve dashboardInfo
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I do not see any unhealthy spyglass services
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down collectd on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that collectd is in the list within "16" seconds
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down fluentd on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that fluentd is in the list within "16" seconds
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down elasticsearch on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that elasticsearch is in the list within "16" seconds
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down opentsdb on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that opentsdb is in the list within "16" seconds
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down kibana on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that kibana is in the list within "16" seconds
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down grafana on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that grafana is in the list within "16" seconds
I have installed Spyglass
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
I ask for a link to the following applications:
a GET request of each URL does not return an error status code

elements.name: Getting Simple Node Metrics via REST API

steps.name: I have installed Spyglass
I specify the query range start as "1h-ago"
I query for the following metrics:
I receive at least "200" values per metric covering that time period
those values may be incorrect but we are only testing for presence

name: Test Transparency
description:
As a Spyglass Stakeholder
In order to ensure a high quality release
I desire to easily view current and past test statuses and connect that information to
JIRA, Github, and Google Sheets

elements.name: View and Edit Manual Gherkin Tests alongside Automated Tests

steps.name: I have marked a Scenario with the @Manual tag
I have run bin/run-end-to-end-tests against some @Manual and some automated tests
the CI Server is running
I view the result in the CI Server
I can see the automated test results in a hierarchical view
the manual steps are editable and in a "not executed" state
I have changed manual test results
I click "save"
I am notified that the save has succeeded
if I navigate to the Test Result Explorer
click back into the previously saved test result
I see it has retained my changes
I am viewing a Test Result or the Test Result Explorer
I type in "@tag1 @tag2 ~@tag3"
the view updates to only show features / scenarios tagged with either @tag1 or @tag2
I also see items that do not have @tag3
all the charts and summaries and statuses update to reflect the filtered view of the test
I am viewing a Test Result or the Test Result Explorer
I change the filter to "Manual Only"
I only see the manual tests
I change the filter to "Automated Only"
I only see the automated tests
I change the filter to "Automated and Manual"
I can see both automated and manual tests
I have some tests that are not associated with a JIRA ticket
I check "show cases with mising JIRA only"
I only see those features / scenarios that have no JIRA ticket
I have tests with various statuses
I check and uncheck the statuses in the upper right
the view and charts update to reflect only the subset of features / scenarios with the matching statuses
I have tested a JQL Query using JIRA and know it to work
I paste that JQL query into the JQL text input
the view filters to show only those tickets which are associated with the JIRA tickets in the JQL result
I search for tags directly by typing them or indirectly via JQL that have no test cases
I see a warning indicating how many tags were found / not found / sought
I see the names of the tags that were not found

elements.name: Tag Name links to JIRA ticket

steps.name: I have some scenarios with a @SPYG-XXX tag
I click said tag name where it appears
I am taken to the JIRA ticket page for that tag
I have an up to date test result with some scenarios with @SPYG-XXX JIRA tags
I click "sync results to JIRA"
I am notified that the results have been synced
when I view the JIRA ticket(s) that should have been updated
I see comments in each ticket summing up the status of that ticket's test
I see summaries of scenarios, features and steps passed / failed / pending / not exected
I see a link that takes me to the CI Portal displaying just that story's results using pre-filtered query

elements.name: Publish Test Result to CI Server using REST API

steps.name: I want to publish a test result from my local computer to the CI server
I do an HTTP PUT to ci-server-host/test-results/my-test-result-name-here
I receive a 200 OK
I see the test result in the Test Result Explorer
I can open and view the test

elements.name: Results can be Synced to JIRA

steps.name: I am viewing a test result in test portal
I click "sync to JIRA"
it updates tagged JIRA issues with test result statuses
